subject: Business
title: The S-Curve of Innovation
description: A quick win: understand The S-Curve of Innovation.

hook.text: Every technology follows the same curve: slow start, rapid growth, then plateau. Understanding this curve is power.

buildup.text: The S-curve shows innovation progress over time: introduction (slow), growth (fast), maturity (plateau).

discovery.text: At the plateau, incremental improvements yield diminishing returns. The technology approaches its physical limits.

twist.text: The next disruption starts a new S-curve that begins below the current one â€” looking inferior before surpassing it.

climax.text: Hard drives followed an S-curve that SSDs disrupted with a new one. SSDs started worse but are now dominant.

punchline.text: Ride the current curve. But watch for the next one starting beneath you.

quiz.question: What happens at the top of an S-curve?
options: Improvements plateau and a new technology may disrupt from below
The technology permanently dominates the market
